data.text:
In 20th-century international relations: Peace treaties and territorial agreements

Trieste was contested by Italy and Yugoslavia and remained under Western occupation until 1954. The major change affected Poland, which was figuratively picked up and moved some 150 miles to the west. This meant that large portions of eastern Germany came under Polish administration, while…

Read More

In John Foster Dulles: Secretary of state

…Germany and Austria, and the Trieste agreement (1954), providing for partition of the free territory between Italy and Yugoslavia.

Read More

In Slovenia: The communist era

Having occupied Trieste in May 1945, the Partisans hoped that its possession was assured, but the Allies forced the establishment of a Free Territory of Trieste, consisting of an Italian-administered zone in and around the city and a Yugoslav zone on the Istrian Peninsula. In 1954 Tito…
